name: The Grand Mayan Riviera Maya

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 7 days at The Grand Mayan for the first part of our honeymoon as a gift from family. The trip was arranged through RCI. We very much enjoyed the overall resort and our stay there! I’m not sure if we’d go back to The Grand Mayan but it was an overall positive experience. The overall prices for the Grand Mayan restaurants are less or comparable to what we spend eating out in Boston.
reviews.title: Fun in Playa Del Carmen and The Grand Mayan

reviews.text: What we liked:
reviews.title: had a nice time but wouldn't go back

likes.disliked: — resort is too isolated and too large

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Breakfast at the 19th Hole and Coffee available at the pool area in the morning
reviews.title: not as great as it seems

likes.liked: — The room was awesome, and very clean
likes.disliked: — resort too large and spread out, no swimming beach, slow service at times

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Room Service – food was just as good and same price as restaurants; outstanding service.
reviews.title: Loved The Grand Mayan!!! Would Go Back!!!

reviews.text: - Breakfast on beach patio at Havana Moon restaurant (think that's the name)
reviews.title: Girls Trip

likes.liked: — Everything was first class. PLENTY OF SPACE in our suite.

reviews.text: We returned from our vacation on Feb. 3/08. The resort spans a HUGE area and like others who have previously written, unless your room is close to the pool, you will be walking a great amount. We were given bldg. 11 of the Grand Mayan and the walk to the restaurants/pool area was 15 minutes. There are shuttles available but they do not come often enough. They seemed to run every 20 to 30 minutes so if you missed one; it is quicker just to walk it. We stayed in a grand master suite which was very nice. Buildings 7 through 12 offer the benefit of new units; they are very spacious. Maid service was very good; they did an excellent job of cleaning our unit every day (including our dishes!) The maids do not speak English, so communication is a bit difficult, although we did manage to explain that our unit did not have a coffee maker and one arrived within 10 minutes. We needed a kitchen repair (cook top problem) and maintenance were there within 10 mins.to solve the problem. Staff throughout the resort were very friendly.
reviews.title: Very nice property..

likes.disliked: — far distance away from beach, pool, restaurants

reviews.text: Restaurants: we ordered from room service the first night and were very happy with the service and the food – excellent prices! We went to the Del Lago for the seafood buffet dinner ($29 pp) and it was o.k. We also tried the Tramonto which offered great food; it was a bit pricier than the others, but it was excellent quality. The Havana Moon was our favorite; great food, very reasonable prices and the band entertainment was excellent!
reviews.title: Lovely resort-not for everyone

likes.liked: — The spacious and well appointed rooms
likes.disliked: — Size of resort and distance between ammenities

reviews.text: The Mayan pool area was very nice; we reserved the palapas on 3 mornings. You need to arrive at the Balche Grill by 7 a.m. to get in line to reserve a same day rental– the staff member arrives at 7:15 It is a slow process, in general it took about 45 minutes of standing in line (with about 10 people ahead of us). Apparently you can reserve the palapa for 2 days. Offering a number system would greatly improve the rental process; at least you could go get a coffee while waiting. The rental cost is $30 per day, but you are credited the $30 back when you order that amount of food and/or drinks from the waiters around the pool. NOTE: when checking out, make sure that the credit is taken off your bill; we had to ask for our $90 credit upon our check out! The beach is, as many others have mentioned, definitely full of rocks and inaccessible. We managed to use our water shoes to cross over the rocky area until we hit a sandy patch, but it is at your own risk to do so, as the rocks are very uneven at that.
reviews.title: Grand Mayan - but Grupo Mayan needs to learn how to treat guests

likes.disliked: — Lack of consistency with the staff, lack of semi-good english skills of staff

reviews.text: Unfortunately we were part of the group that experienced the fire that caused damage to a few areas of the property. We were on the second floor, in the Cyber Café exactly when the fire started right beside our building. The Cafe had a glass wall so we were able to see the fire which began on the grass roof of one building structure; and quickly spread to the adjoining grass roofs. We could feel the intense heat and we were told by staff to run. Everyone in the vicinity was told to go to the beach as a safety precaution. We were not able to get back to our room for a few hours and did not realize that the entire Grand Mayan lobby had been burned down and thanks to the blowing wind, a grass thatch roof over building 7 had also caught fire. It took about 20 minutes before were could hear fire trucks on the premises. Attached are a few pictures we managed to take while still in the Cyber Café. The power was down for a few hours after the fire, so we decided to leave the property and go into Playa del Carmen. When we arrived back by late afternoon, power was restored and things went back to normal pretty fast. You could smell and occasionally see the charred remains of the remnants which had blown throughout the property and the Grand Mayan pool was closed for cleanup as it was next to the initial fire site.
reviews.title: badly run & understaffed.

likes.disliked: — Site badly managed and understaffed. Terrible srvice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would we go back again? Even though the property and accommodations were beautiful, probably not. The required daily walks to the pool/

likes.liked: — Great size rooms, clean, nice view.

reviews.text: Review for: Grand Mayan Riviera Maya, Playa del Carmen Tulum, Xcaret, & Chichen Itza
reviews.title: Do your research, know what your getting and you'll love it!

likes.disliked: — Food was a little average and didn't seem very Mexican

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We received so much good information on this site before we went. I'll try to add some information that I don't recall reading. We stayed at the Grand Mayan Riviera Maya January 13-20, 2008. We reserved the 2 bedroom unit (joining a Grand Suite and a Grand Master Room a 2 bedroom Grand Master Suite is obtained) through an RCI timeshare trade. There were 4 adults in their 30's and 2 children ages 2 & 4. We rented a minivan and visited Playa del Carmen, Tulum, Xcaret and Chichen Itza. I'll explain the resort and these trips below.
reviews.title: Steer Well Clear

likes.disliked: — pushy timeshare people, boring boring boring

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at the resort at 1:00 and were able to check-in to our unit right away. We were placed in building 10 and I asked if anything was available in buildings 1-7. We were told nothing right now since a convention was being held there. They probably would have something the next day as the conventioneers were leaving. We opted to stay where we were. Building 10 is not as close to the pools, etc. but it was just finished this past summer. I believe buildings 8-13 were all built at this time. The location ended up being fine.
reviews.title: Stay Away

reviews.text: Shuttles: We didn't have many problems with the shuttles. They came around often. Sometimes we would start walking and if we met a shuttle we would hop on. The shuttles have 1 of 4 colored flags on them so you look for a color of shuttle going where you want. This way you don't have to ride around picking up a lot of other people. It worked well. There are 2 shuttle stops by the pools that are a little hidden that will really save you a lot of walking--one behind Belche' and one behind Del Lago restaurants. You sometimes need to take a shuttle to a lobby and then take a shuttle to your unit from the lobby. It really wasn't bad. The walk would have been find too, but we often had to carry tired 2 and 4 year olds at night.
reviews.title: We will never return!

likes.disliked: — Resort was built without planning for guests in outlaying units. There were no services, pools or restaurants for any of the buildings away from the main lobby area. Very poorly planned and executed resort in spite of the lovely surroundings that area of Mexico affords tourists.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Resort: We really like the location of the resort. I read reviews saying it was "in the middle of nowhere". It is actually right on the main highway along with a lot of other resorts in the Riviera Maya. No, you are not going to be able to walk to town but it's not exactly "isolated". I decided the Riviera Maya area was a much better location for us than the Cancun hotel district. The Cancun hotel area is really all by itself and if you plan to go to the major attractions in the area (Tulum, Xcaret, Xel-ha, Coba) then you are going to have a much longer drive. If you prefer to stay mainly at your hotel and go to clubs at night than Cancun probably a better choice for you. There were a number of evening activities at the resort. We are not really late night people so we were back in our unit by 11:00 or earlier every night. The travel agency at the hotel does have Playa del Carmen and Cancun bar hopping trips so you can experience that on your vacation if you'd like. Yes, the resort is huge- which is what we wanted...we wanted a lot of options, amenities and a big pool.
reviews.title: Great Place!

likes.disliked: — no comfortable chair in room ( I know pretty picky!)

reviews.title: Loved it!
reviews.text: We are Grand Mayan owners and stayed in the Riviera Maya for the first time in Sept. We, of course, knew what to expect when we arrived at our room....we have a two bedroom unit....clean, spacious, comfortable and we loved it! The check-in was painless as usual and were given our room before check-in time. We had a wonderful, relaxing afternoon after our travel and a nice dinner at the resort.

reviews.title: We were IN the fire
reviews.text: There are two pools--one exclusively for Grand Mayan--and both were outstanding. The large pool has activites, bars, huge beautiful beds surrounding the pool and some very shallow areas to accomodate small children. The GM pool is smaller, has its own little beach area and is quieter. Both were very enjoyable, clean and well cared for. Both have a happy hour at the bars. The beach was lovely however it was hard to get into the water there as a hurricane had swept away the sand in the water and eco restrictions don't allow them to replace it.

We loved the seclusion of the resort (just a few resorts nearby) and the proximity to some wonderful areas. The concierge service is wonderful and they are always ready to help with really good information. There are also tours available there and they will pick you up at the resort.. We drove into Playa de Carmen, had dinner, bought groceries andtook the ferry to Cozumel. We went into Cancun and had a great time but were glad that we didn't stay in that overcrowded, jammed up hotel area. Very busy, lots of traffic. It was nice to be in our laid back venue. We were delighted to find out how many things there were to see in the area if we chose.
reviews.title: Isolated Resort on Riviera Maya

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service was great. The maids were wonderful and kept our room immaculate. Many people have a problem with the scarcity of wash cloths--we have traveled in Mexico for many years and there a many places who don't give them to you at all. Perhaps this is not something they normally use. However, we were usually provided with some at this resort. After reading some of the reviews this seems to be a problem for some people. We loved our little kitchen and normally prepared our breakfast and lunch there. Then we would go out for dinner. The water is purified and we've never had a problem.
reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised

reviews.text: There are a lot of activities at the resort and a club for children too. I like the water aerobics personally. There are crafts, outdoor movies, etc. There are snorkel and scuba tours and instruction that leave from the resort. We have no small children but this seems a perfect place for a family. You would never have to leave there if you chose not to. There is an area with flamingos, an internet cafe and coffee bar. There is also a small grocery store there.
reviews.title: Timeshare Sales Presentation goes on even when the resort is on Fire!

likes.disliked: — Isolated, overpriced for food and drink, too big.

aka: The Grand Mayan Riviera Maya Hotel
